title: The Institutional Act
segmentation: Thank you very much.
Good morning everybody.
Thanks so much for coming and thank you for inviting me here to kind of coordinate this debate.
It's a real pleasure to be part of this event and I was very honored to be asked and we've got a panel of people here today to talk to you all about their institutions and the role of their.
The role of their institutions and not just reflecting architectural practice, but actually producing it, narrating it, and instigating what I believe to be a kind of knew.
And you kind of error for the institution of architecture.

I'm interested in institutions because I'm the Chief curator of quite a big institution in Lisbon, Lisbon architecture Triennale E and I've been involved in setting up an institution in London called the Gopher Hole.
I've curated an exhibition in an.
China called the Shenzen Hong Kong being alianne in Korea.

The Guangxu, designed in early and increasingly I feel that the role of these institutions has has started to revolve in a way that produces culture in a very real way that the Commissioners of Exhibitions Ann and the directors of institutions are more than the archival practice that it used to be.
It's more than it's more than the ability to kind of Clayton collect and identify it's it's actually producing completely knew.

An continue debates completely new cultures and a very important aspect of that which is the ability for architecture to exist outside of the boundaries of the building and to be something much more expensive and and and much more open for discussion and debate.
So.

I will be talking a little bit about the Lisbon architecture.

Team of people who I hope will reflect a little bit about my thesis about how exciting and important institutions will be in the 21st century.

Kind of the carousel of of what being allies have been over the last few years and we we felt that it was really critical to create a structure which would allow completely new commissions and Fort Renal to somehow projects into the future about about what architecture could be.

It would be about the kind of the structures and ideas around architecture and not just about the buildings, because architecture is something that we can quite easily kind of wander along the street and see an the idea of.
